sub_title: Team Leadership / Operational efficiency / Working Framework Implementation / Innovation / Tennis & Padel Lover
summary:
A curious learner who continuously tries out different ways of doing things while seeking to apply new ideas.

My diverse and multicultural background makes me a versatile and quickly adaptable person able to work in multiple subjects and environments.

I have experience in leadership roles where groups need to be coached to accomplish a goal, through an openminded and empathic behavior to listen and understand all viewpoints. My capacity to synthesize information and see the key points of a situation allows me to elaborate strategies and make decisions to guide teams.

Used to work in transformation programs. Used to working in waterfall-structured projects, I’ve introduced Agile methods in different projects, both as a coach and as a project leader, within diverse environments to increase efficiency and motivation. I have also experience in introducing digital tools in teams such as Virtual Reality, Remote Assistance, or Microsoft environments. 

I love communication. I speak fluently Spanish, English, and French. I am used to speaking in on-site crowded conferences, remote ones, or 1-1 discussions, giving feedback (positives or correctives), and persuading or coaching others. Process Communication is a tool I use regularly to adapt the way I communicate. I am used to driving brainstorming sessions, including retrospectives.

Initiative and creativity help me to unblock a huge number of situations in my life. Commitment and rigorousness allow me to keep the right path at the appropriate pace to carry out the mission in which I am enrolled. And my emotional intelligence allows me to be aware of my emotions to create and maintain the best relations with people. 

Entrepreneurship is in my veins. I created and launched a networking event held at my home University, to create and maintain links between former and current students, while promoting ideas and inspiring people. I recently launched a podcast called "The Future is Here and Now" where I talk to people about the sense of work. I also coach teams to become more efficient. 

A sports lover, regular tennis and padel player. Insatiable reader, I combine novels with personal development articles, cultural differences books, or no matter an interesting topic. Getting lost in Nature during disconnecting hiking is an activity I practice in family. And when I travel, I always look for being in touch with people to know as much as possible about the local culture.

Do you need help with your teams to improve their way of working? Contact me and tell me what are you struggling with!

awards.title: European Doctorate label
awards.description:
First PhD candidate of the Université du Havre that obtains this label. 
https://www.univ-lehavre.fr/spip.php?article861

This label is granted to those doctors who has completed their PhD subjected to the following conditions:
1. The doctorate must, in part, have been prepared during a research internship period of at least three months in another European country. 
2. Oral presentation authorisation is granted on the basis of reports submitted by at least three professors comprising at least two from higher education institutions from two European countries other than the country in which the oral thesis presentation is to be held. The host laboratory representative cannot submit this report.
3. At least one member of the jury should belong to an European higher education institution from a different country to that in which the oral thesis presentation is held.
4. Part of the oral thesis presentation should be conducted in an official language of the European Community which is not the language of the country in which the presentation is held.

awards.title: Top of the class student of the year. Engineering School of Universidad de Málaga 2011/2012
awards.description:
Award delivered to the best student of the year by a jury made up teachers of the Technical Engineering School of the Universidad de Málaga, after assessing the following points:
- Record (marks, number of years taken to finish the degree, additional subjects, etc)
- Final degree project (subject originality, methodology employed, resolution process, bibliography, presentation quality, etc)
- Additional merits

projects.title: Espetos Industriales
projects.description:
Espetos Industriales is a project and a registered trademark born in 2018 with the aim of sharing knowledge and connecting people with the common interest in the city of Malaga and Engineering.

I launched, developed, managed and presented the first two editions held in 2018 and 2020. 

On March 2018, 15 former students, mainly from the University of Malaga, but also educated in other institutions, went to the Escuela de Ingenierias of Malaga to present their personal and profesional experiences and the companies they worked for at that time. On that occasion students and other interested people could exchange during a 1 day face-to-face event. I also participated as a speaker introducing my early career in Industry, after having worked in Research, and introduce Renault Spain and its sites. 

On March 2020 the 2nd face-to-face meeting had to be delayed due to Coronavirus Pandemic. Then, a remote event took place with 1-hour talks, starting on the beginning of November, and ending at the end of December. I also had the pleasure to give the first talk where I could explain the Production Engineering brach to the attendees and introduce the electric motor assembly Process inside Groupe Renault.

On May 2022 I'll participate as a speaker.

projects.title: The Future is Here and Now
projects.description: The Future is Here and Now is a project that aims to create a consciousness on people about how works influence their lives. During one hour I discuss with different people about what is work for them and how they integrate it into their lives. Conversation are broadcasted in video and podcast versions.

authors.headline: Team Leadership / Operational efficiency / Working Framework Implementation / Innovation / Tennis & Padel Lover

profile_positions.description:
Inside the Engineering department, I lead the R&D team composed of Electrical, Integration, Mechanical, and Software engineers in charge of the development of full flight simulators. I currently work in:
- Building, coordinating, guiding, and coaching the team. 
- Operational efficiency to make interactions and processes within the team smooth and efficient. 
- Working culture to ensure people feel motivated and valued, fostering this way creativity. 
- People development to facilitate the growth and development of the team members.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
As member of an Engineering department, I led a team of Electrical and Mechanical engineers in charge of the product development of full flight simulators. The scope of the role was:
- Line management, building, coordination, guidance, and coaching of the team. 
- Product management of the different components of the simulators
- Project management of the engineering activities
- Internal customers management
- External suppliers management
profile_positions.title: Lead Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Inside the electrical powertrain production department I was in charge of the technical project management for the industrialisation (design, development, installation, commissioning and performance ramp-up) of a new electric powertrain assembly line for Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi Alliance in France and in close collaboration with Japan.
- Planning, organising, monitoring and reporting
- Ensuring the respect of milestones, from RFQ to SOP and ramp-up.
- Tens of million euros - CAPEX project including 60 facilities
- Technical management of technicians, engineers and international suppliers
- Office, remote and on site based
- Collaboration with cross-fonctional teams: manufacturing, design office, quality, experts, tooling, ergonomist, safety, mainteance, planning, prototypes, logistics and purchases.
- Direct report to project manager and senior project manager
- Direct counterpart of Japanese Project Engineer

Participation in different cross-functional activities inside the engineering department : 
- Leading of a workgroup to line up the activities of all project engineers
- Internal analysis of different engineering roles
- Leading on the use of Virtual Reality for facilities validation
- Leading of the use of remote assistance digital tool for facilities commissioning

- Coaching of 5 engineering school students from 2018 to 2020.
profile_positions.title: Project engineer

profile_positions.description: My goal was to boost the mindset change for improving the daily work culture by deploying Agile methods. I coached and accompanied managers in the use of Agile methods inside a Production Engineering Department.
profile_positions.title: Agile transformation enabler

profile_positions.description: As part of the Corporate division of the Powertrain Advanced Production Engineering, I was in charge of the innovation area of diesel engines assembly lines and give support to all factories in the world by unifying assembly procedures of diesel engines.
profile_positions.title: Process design engineer

profile_positions.description:
Member of the Advanced Engineering department, a multidisciplinary team in charge of development of new lighting modules for car makers during the pre-development, RFQ phase, up to the serial production.
- Member of the project team in charge of the Headlight development of the most-sold models of the largest German car manufacturer.
- Design of heat dissipation systems through numerical investigations with cost-driven solutions that fulfil client requirements. Choice of electronic components (LEDs and PCBs), heat sink type, fans, etc.
- Participation in numerous R&D projects for the product development: optics, electronics, assembly, manufacturing, plastic and metal injection
- Requirements and functional analysis, with D-FMEA writing
- Patent of innovative solutions and competition benchmarking
- Contact with clients and writing of technical presentations
- Organisation of weekly co-coaching innovation meetings
- Presentations at Universities to make known the company
profile_positions.title: R&D Engineer

company.name: CNRS - Centre national de la recherche scientifique

profile_positions.description:
PhD thesis in the framework of the program Laboratoire d'Excellence Energy Materials and Clean Combustion Center (LabEx EMC3) 

Experimental study of turbulent flows in a rotating machine (Taylor-Couette system): relationship between the rotation speed of the rotor and the power consumption

Experimental study of viscoelastic fluid flows in a rotating machine: analysis of the energy dissipated as a function of the flow structure and the speed of the rotor

Rheology of viscoelastic fluids

Use of the technique Planar Laser Induced Fluorescence (PLIF) in order to study the temperature of the fluid

http://www.theses.fr/s80771
